Articles.Content:
I was looking through the Squad folder in GameData, hoping to find some of the soundtracks. Turns out I got more than what I was looking for!

It's a new un-added soundtrack called editorLoop01. The number at the end may indicate there's more to come. In my opinion, the music has a nice beat, it's so much better than all of the other editor soundtracks. Unfortunately, I have no way to post it, but I bet it's in your folders too! (GameData -> Squad -> Sounds)

Interesting, i have heard that music before...

Anyway, it sounds awesome, we should have it, just with more instrumentation

*Opens Visual Studio and starts coding*

EDIT:

Most of the KSP music is made by Kevin Macleod, check incompetech.com

Cheers
I can listen to it, it sounds like a version of the start screen music.

Nothing I have can open the file except windows movie maker (why?), and even then it says its corrupt... Any ideas?

EDIT: Tried opening it in Windows Media Player, still wont play.

Edited January 22, 2015 by RocketPilot573

Nothing I have can open the file except windows movie maker (why?), and even then it says its corrupt... Any ideas?

I use VLC Media Player to play .ogg files. Here's a link: http://www.videolan.org/vlc/index.html

I use VLC Media Player to play .ogg files. Here's a link: http://www.videolan.org/vlc/index.html

Huh, I never realized I can't play .ogg.... I at least expected video editing software's and such to be able to use it.
This has been there for several versions now and I think it was the old editor music from long, long ago before the current music was added.

Sorry if this is off topic, but the main menu music would insinuate the Kerbals like to ride motorcycles or.. something that altleast sounds like them. Now its not the music per-say, but more the ambient idle music you get after you let the main menu linger for awhile. You hear sounds of motorcycles going by.

The only question remaining:

Is this more, or less annoying than the current "do do do dee da do dee do da" music in the VAB/SPH?

I vote for less, but that's probably because I haven't listened to it for an hour straight while designing a complex craft...
Alright, I've found I can open it in Audacity. I'll just say it's... different.
I can confirm that the music has been in the game's folder since at least version 0.13, though curiously it was not used in the editor.
